image.altText: A closeup of Dinush's face.

props.synopsis: A man accused of fatally attacking his estranged wife with a hatchet and a kitchen knife is pleading not guilty to murder, with his lawyers telling the jury he was acting in self-defence.

title.children: Melbourne mother's cries for 'help' recorded on watch as she was allegedly murdered by estranged husband

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers faces a nervous wait over the next six days to the Reserve Bank of Australia rate decision even if today's inflation data look to have handed him a brief political 'get-out-of-jail' card.

title.children: Inflation figures may give the government a rate rise reprieve next week, but the path is not yet certain

image.altText: A group of unidentifiable players wear a Collingwood gurnsey.

props.synopsis: Collingwood president Jeff Browne says he "totally and absolutely" has full faith in chief executive Craig Kelly, following allegations he made slurs and jokes about Indigenous culture.

title.children: Collingwood president has full faith in CEO following allegations of racial discrimination

image.altText: three men stand chatting on the front steps of the church

props.synopsis: Dwindling congregations and ageing churches being sold off is a familiar story across Australia but this town in regional Victoria is bucking the trend.Â

title.children: How steely locals saved their 130yo church from going under the hammer

image.altText: An interpretation of the Greek God Dionysus featuring DJ Barbara Butch in a silver headress.

props.synopsis: French DJ Barbara Butch says she's received death threats over her appearance in the Paris Olympics' opening ceremony.

title.children: Police investigating online abuse targeting French DJ caught in 'Last Supper' controversy

image.altText: A man in medical scrubs, folding his arms and staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Rex says regional flights will continue as the company enters voluntary administration, but the situation has left doctors like Bega-based surgeon Matthew Nott feeling nervous.

title.children: Rex continues regional flights, but doctors say health services are 'vulnerable'

image.altText: The historic Billson's Brewery with two chimneys and a faded antique sign on the side

props.synopsis: The owners of a popular drinks company in North East Victoria have described the "excruciatingly difficult" decision to put their business into voluntary administration.

title.children: Jobs at risk as historic Billson's Brewery announces voluntary administration

image.altText: Geelong mum Sheridan Digby standing outside in sunlight, looking off to the side with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Sheridan Digby had hoped a 2019 remedial massage would help fix her sore neck. Instead, she says it caused her to suffer a stroke. The Geelong mum is now suing the masseuse and medical clinic, arguing they are liable for her injuries.

title.children: Sheridan suffered a stroke after a massage. Now she's suing the masseuse for negligence

image.altText: IsmailÂ HaniyehÂ sitting on a chair with a curtain behind him.

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a statement to say its top political leader has been killed in Iran.

title.children: Hamas' top political leader Ismail Haniyeh killed in Iran

image.altText: Amanda Rishworth standing at a podium with a microphone, talking to the media, wearing a pink jacket

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed its response to the landmark disability royal commission, but has not committed to a number of the most contentious recommendations.

title.children: After years of 'harrowing evidence', the federal government has responded to the disability royal commission

image.altText: A shot from almost beneath the water of the River Seine shows the banks and the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: After days of speculation and ongoing testing, Paris's iconic River Seine has been deemed safe to host the swimming leg of the men's and women's Olympic triathlon.

title.children: Olympic triathletes given all clear to swim in River Seine despite days of water quality concerns

image.altText: Sabrina James and Marjorie Johnston share a laugh

props.synopsis: In the midst of a housing crisis, roughly 12 million bedrooms sit empty. But housemates Marjorie Johnston and Sabrina James reckon they have hit on a solution.

title.children: With a housing crisis and 12 million empty bedrooms, these housemates reckon they have a solution

image.altText: Bronny James and LeBron James

props.synopsis: Last month, the LA Lakers gave themselves the unique opportunity to create NBA history by drafting Bronny James, the son of LeBron James. The first month of the youngster's career has shown he has a tough road ahead.

title.children: LeBron and his son playing on the same NBA team is historic â why is it making basketball fans uncomfortable?

image.altText: GettyImages-2163919545

props.synopsis: Jessica Fox is proving as relentless as Paris' burning afternoon sun in her hunt for matching gold medals.

title.children: One gold medal isn't enough for Jessica Fox â that's why she's swapping the kayak for the canoe

image.altText: Australian swimmer Kaylee McKeown smiles on pooldeck as she wears her gold medal and holds a box and a toy kangaroo.

props.synopsis: After defending her 100m backstroke title and setting a new Olympic record, Kaylee McKeown pays a heartfelt tribute to her father, who died in 2020.

title.children: 'He was with me tonight': McKeown pays tribute to late father after historic gold

image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: Australia's annual rate of inflation lifted to 3.8 per cent in the June quarter, up from 3.6 per cent.

title.children: Inflation up but RBA's 'core' target fell, delivering 'good news' on future rate rise

image.altText: Simone Biles after finishing her routine

props.synopsis: Three years after she missed the same event with the "twisties", Simone Biles has helped the USA win gold in the artistic gymnastics women's team final in Paris.

title.children: Simone Biles breaks US Olympic record with another gold

image.altText: An empty check in counter inside an airport terminal with signs displaying "check in" for "Rex".

props.synopsis: Administrators overseeing Rex Airlines have told hundreds of employees they are unlikely to receive their wages or redundancy payouts for "months", and expect the domestic aviation business will cease operating by the end of the day.

title.children: 350 Rex Airlines employees stood down immediately as administrators warn staff are unlikely to be paid for 'months'

image.altText: A middle-aged man with his arms crossed stands in front of rolling fields.

props.synopsis: A Victorian government scheme designed to fast-track renewable projects is leaving those wanting to appeal approvals with limited options for recourse.

title.children: Landowner all but powerless to fight the solar farm proposal threatening his slice of paradise

image.altText: Fencers compete in Le Grand Palais

props.synopsis: Paris offers a rich vein of jewels to house temporary stadiums during the 2024 Olympic Games â but Le Grand Palais, home of fencing, is something else.

title.children: Of all the grand venues being used for the Paris Olympics, the fencing might be housed in the grandest of them all

image.altText: QH artwork

props.synopsis: An Olympic star makes an incredible pregnancy reveal shortly after competing, a gold medallist's moment ruined by overzealous photographers, and Coco Gauff's Olympic dream ends in tears after an umpire run-in. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: An incredible pregnancy reveal, a gold medal moment ruined by photographers, and Coco Gauff's tearful exit

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair and a half smile ,wearing an orange top, sits at a table

props.synopsis: While the Miles Franklin judges may not have deemed it shortlist-worthy, Charlotte Wood's Stone Yard Devotional is now up for the Booker Prize.

title.children: Aussie Charlotte Wood longlisted for one of the most prestigious awards in international literature

image.altText: Trump is seen in profile close up with a bloodied face and hands on the ground

props.synopsis: The acting director said his agency had made a mistake in assuming local police would take responsibility for securing the roof where a shooter later opened fire on Donald Trump's rally.

title.children: US Secret Service chief blames Trump security lapse on local police

image.altText: A close up of Gretta Ray's posing for photographers at the ARIA awards

props.synopsis: The Australian singer says she is regaining her strength, but will need to return to hospital for heart surgery in the future.Â

title.children: Gretta Ray cancels shows to recover from rare heart disease

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: Inflation rises 3.8 per cent in year to June in line with economists' expectations. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation rises 3.8 per cent in year to June

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bank of Japan raises interest rates in surprise move
What does this mean for interest rates?

image.altText: A concrete building is damaged and crumbling after an apparent air attack

props.synopsis: Israel's air force says its air strike targeted Fuad Shukr who it claims was responsible for ordering an attack on Golan Heights that left 12 people dead at the weekend.

title.children: IDF says it has killed 'Hezbollah's most senior military commander' in air strike on Beirut

image.altText: A young woman holding a black and white photo of her mother.

props.synopsis: Romany Wake and Shakira Robertson used to be next door neighbours. Now they're trying to support each other after both their mothers were killed tragically in separate incidents.

title.children: 'I've just killed your mum': Romany Wake's father committed murder, then told her to call triple-0

image.altText: A Hungarian boxer in blue and an Australian boxer in red look agitated as they punch each other in the face.

props.synopsis: Harry Garside's Olympics boxing loss demonstrates in an acutely memorable way just how costly it can be for a human being to devote everything in their power to a specific endeavour and not succeed.

title.children: The ringside interview that seemed more painful than being punched in the face, and taught us a lesson about failure

image.altText: A red and yellow light display in the sky

props.synopsis: The aurora australis has returned, lighting up the skies over southern states. If you missed out on seeing it last night you may get another chance.

title.children: 'Spectacular' aurora display wows Australia again

image.altText: A composite image of three young girls, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift pays tribute to the children killed and injured in a stabbing attack at a dance class being held to her music on Monday, saying she's "completely in shock", as the death toll from the incident rises.

title.children: Taylor Swift pays tribute to children killed in UK stabbing attack at dance class as death toll rises

image.altText: A woman wearing a protective mask walks with a bike in China.

props.synopsis: The Pathway to Clean Indoor Air in Victoria could speed up the end of the current pandemic and help us prepare for the next one. But improving indoor air quality won't just bring health benefits â it could also boost businesses' bottom lines.

title.children: We've cleaned our drinking water for decades. Why don't we do the same with the air we breathe?

image.altText: A doctor gives Hunter a spoonful of puree with peanut powder in it.

props.synopsis: Babies with a peanut allergy will be offered oral immunotherapy in Australia for the first time as part of a new standardised model of care in hospitals across the country.Â

title.children: Nine-month-old Hunter is receiving treatment for his peanut allergy under a world-first hospital model

image.altText: Two men in rain jackets, walk with a woman who is carrying a child through the mud.

props.synopsis: Local authorities say rescue operations have been hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.

title.children: Landslides in India's Kerala state kill at least 151 and injure more than 180

image.altText: A woman sits next to a curtain

props.synopsis: When Jennifer entered perimenopause, three doctors and a gynaecologist initially ruled out the diagnosis. She and other women tell a Senate inquiry they are frustrated by the medical community's lack of understanding.

title.children: Women say doctors don't believe them about perimenopause as inquiry hears of 'gaslighting'
